 21 -class TreeNode(object): 

 22      """ 
 23      A node in a tree structure. 
 24   
 25      @ivar parent: The parent node in the tree structure. 
 26      @ivar children: List of child nodes. 
 27      """ 

 28 -    def __init__(self, parent): 

 29          """ 
 30          Construct a new L{TreeNode} 
 31   
 32          If parent is not `None`, then the new node will be automatically 
 33          added to the tree structure. 
 34   
 35          @param parent: The parent of this node, or `None` for the 
 36              root of a tree. 
 37          """ 
 38          self.parent = parent 
 39          self.children = [] 

 40   
 41      @property 

 42 -    def parent(self): 

 43          """ 
 44          The parent node of this node. 
 45   
 46          Setting this property will automatically insert the node into 
 47          the tree structure by adding the node to its parent's list of 
 48          children. If the node had a previous parent it is first removed 
 49          from the old parent's children. 
 50          """ 
 51          return self._parent 

 52      @parent.setter 

 53 -    def parent(self, newParent): 

 54          if getattr(self, '_parent', None) is not None: 
 55              self._parent.children.remove(self) 
 56          if newParent is not None: 
 57              newParent.children.append(self) 
 58          self._parent = newParent 

 59   
 60      @property 

 61 -    def hasParent(self): 

 62          """ 
 63          Whether this node has a parent. 
 64          """ 
 65          return self.parent is not None 

 66   
 67      @property 

 68 -    def hasChildren(self): 

 69          """ 
 70          Whether this node has any children. 
 71          """ 
 72          return len(self.children) > 0 

 73   
 74      @property 

 75 -    def root(self): 

 76          """ 
 77          The root node of the tree structure this node is part of. 
 78          """ 
 79          return self.parent.root if self.hasParent else self 

 80   
 81      @property 

 82 -    def depth(self): 

 83          return 0 if not self.hasParent else (self.parent.depth + 1) 

 84   

 85 -    def ascendTree(self): 

 86          """ 
 87          Generator returning the nodes of the tree encountered while ascending 
 88          from the current node to the root node. 
 89   
 90          E.g. for the tree:: 
 91   
 92                  A 
 93                 / \ 
 94                B   C 
 95               / \   \ 
 96              D   E   F 
 97   
 98          D.ascendTree() would return a generator yielding D, B, A. 
 99   
100          @return: A generator that returns the nodes of the tree encountered 
101              while ascending from the current node to the root. 
102          """ 
103          yield self 
104          if self.hasParent: 
105              for point in self.parent.ascendTree(): 
106                  yield point 

107   

108 -    def preorderTraversal(self, preFunc=None, postFunc=None, 
109              condition=lambda p: True): 

110          """ 
111          Perform a pre-order depth-first traversal of the tree structure. 
112   
113          The traversal will start from this node. At each node traversed, 
114          callback functions will be called with the current node as the 
115          only argument. 
116   
117          @param preFunc: Function to call before traversing to the next node. 
118          @param postFunc: Function to call after traversing the child nodes. 
119          @param condition: Condition that nodes must meet to be included. 
120   
121          @return: A generator that returns the nodes of the (sub-)tree rooted 
122              at this joint, that meet the given condition, in depth first 
123              pre-order. 
124          """ 
125   
126          cond = condition(self) 
127          if cond: 
128              if preFunc is not None: preFunc(self) 
129              yield self 
130          for child in self.children: 
131              for grandchild in child.preorderTraversal(preFunc, 
132                      postFunc, condition): 
133                  yield grandchild 
134          if cond: 
135              if postFunc is not None: postFunc(self) 

136   

137 -    def __iter__(self): 

138          return self.preorderTraversal()
